00027   bool Logger :: mInitialized = false;
00028   bool Logger :: mGlobalIsLogging[5] = { true, true, true, true, true };
00029   jclass Logger :: mClass = 0;
00030   jmethodID Logger :: mGetLoggerMethod = 0;
00031   jmethodID Logger :: mLogMethod = 0;

00033   Mutex* Logger :: mClassMutex = 0;

00035   /*
00036    * This method formats the message with
00037    * file and line number if given.
00038    */
00039   static
00040   int formatMsg(char * msgBuf, int bufLen,
00041       const char *aFilename, int lineNo,
00042       const char *aFormat, va_list ap)
00043   {
00044     int bytesWritten = 0;
00045     if (msgBuf && bufLen > 0) {
00046       *msgBuf = 0;
00047       if (aFormat && *aFormat)
00048       {
00049         bytesWritten += vsnprintf(msgBuf, bufLen, aFormat, ap);
00050 
00051         if (aFilename && *aFilename) {
00052           bufLen -= bytesWritten;
00053           msgBuf += bytesWritten;
00054 
00055           bytesWritten += snprintf(msgBuf, bufLen, " (%s:%d)",
00056               aFilename, lineNo);
00057         }
00058       }
00059     }
00060     return bytesWritten;
00061   }
00062   Logger :: Logger(const char* loggerName, jobject javaLogger)
00063   {
00064     Logger::init();
00065     for(unsigned int i =0 ; i< sizeof(mIsLogging)/sizeof(bool); i++)
00066       mIsLogging[i] = true;
00067 
00068     strncpy(mLoggerName, loggerName, sizeof(mLoggerName));
00069 
00070     mJavaLogger = 0;
00071     JNIEnv *env=JNIHelper::sGetEnv();
00072     if (env && javaLogger)
00073     {
00074       mJavaLogger = env->NewGlobalRef(javaLogger);
00075     }
00076   }
00077 
00078   Logger :: ~Logger()
00079   {
00080     JNIEnv *env=JNIHelper::sGetEnv();
00081     if (env)
00082     {
00083       if (mJavaLogger)
00084         env->DeleteGlobalRef(mJavaLogger);
00085     }
00086     mJavaLogger = 0;
00087   }

00089   bool
00090   Logger :: init()
00091   {
00092     if (!mInitialized)
00093     {
00094       JNIHelper::sRegisterInitializationCallback(initJavaBindings,0);
00095       mInitialized=true;
00096     }
00097     return mInitialized;
00098   }
00099 
00100   void
00101   Logger :: initJavaBindings(JavaVM*, void*)
00102   {
00103     JNIEnv *env=JNIHelper::sGetEnv();
00104     if (env)
00105     {
00106       // We're inside a JVM, let's get to work.
00107       jclass cls=env->FindClass("com/xuggle/ferry/NativeLogger");
00108       if (cls)
00109       {
00110         // and find all our methods
00111 
00112         mGetLoggerMethod = env->GetStaticMethodID(cls,
00113             "getLogger",
00114             "(Ljava/lang/String;)Lcom/xuggle/ferry/NativeLogger;"
00115         );
00116         mLogMethod = env->GetMethodID(cls,
00117             "log",
00118             "(ILjava/lang/String;)Z"
00119         );
00120 
00121         // keep a reference around
00122         mClass = (jclass)env->NewWeakGlobalRef(cls);
00123 
00124         if (!mClassMutex) {
00125           mClassMutex = Mutex::make();
00126         }
00127       }
00128     }
00129   }
00130   void
00131   Logger :: shutdownJavaBindings(JavaVM* vm, void*closure)
00132   {
00133     Logger* pLogger = (Logger*)closure;
00134     if (!vm && pLogger)
00135     {
00136       // we're shutting down but we were never in the vm; kill this closure.
00137       delete pLogger;
00138     }
00139   }

00142   Logger *
00143   Logger :: getLogger(const char * loggerName)
00144   {
00145 
00146     Logger* retval = 0;
00147     if (loggerName && *loggerName)
00148     {
00149       if (mGetLoggerMethod)
00150       {
00151         JNIEnv *env=JNIHelper::sGetEnv();
00152         if (env)
00153         {
00154           jobject javaLogger = 0;
00155           jstring jLoggerName = env->NewStringUTF(loggerName);
00156           // Time to get a Java Logger
00157           javaLogger = env->CallStaticObjectMethod(mClass,
00158               mGetLoggerMethod, jLoggerName);
00159           env->DeleteLocalRef(jLoggerName);
00160           jLoggerName = 0;
00161 
00162           retval = new Logger(loggerName, javaLogger);
00163 
00164           if (javaLogger)
00165             env->DeleteLocalRef(javaLogger);
00166           javaLogger = 0;
00167         }
00168       } else {
00169         retval = new Logger(loggerName, 0);
00170       }
00171 
00172     }
00173     return retval;
00174   }
00175 
00176   Logger*
00177   Logger :: getStaticLogger(const char *aLoggerName)
00178   {
00179     Logger* logger = 0;
00180 
00181     logger = Logger::getLogger(aLoggerName);
00182     if (logger)
00183     {
00184         // Register a function to kill it when the JNIHelper says we
00185         // can
00186         JNIHelper::sRegisterTerminationCallback(Logger::shutdownJavaBindings,
00187             logger);
00188     }
00189     return logger;
00190   }

00204   bool
00205   Logger :: doLog(Level level, const char *msg)
00206   {
00207     bool didLog = false;
00208     if (mGlobalIsLogging[level] && mIsLogging[level])
00209     {
00210       if (mClassMutex)
00211       {
00212         didLog = this->doJavaLog(level, msg);
00213       } else {
00214         didLog = this->doNativeLog(level, msg);
00215       }
00216     }
00217 
00218     if (!didLog)
00219       // turn off logging so we don't keep trying to log
00220       // here.
00221       mIsLogging[level] = didLog;
00222 
00223     return didLog;
00224   }
00225 
00226   bool
00227   Logger :: doNativeLog(Level level, const char *msg)
00228   {
00229     bool didLog = false;
00230     const char * levelStr = "";
00231     switch(level)
00232     {
00233     case LEVEL_ERROR:
00234       levelStr="ERROR ";
00235       didLog = true;
00236       break;
00237     case LEVEL_WARN:
00238       levelStr = "WARN ";
00239       didLog = true;
00240       break;
00241     case LEVEL_INFO:
00242       levelStr = "INFO ";
00243       didLog = true;
00244       break;
00245     case LEVEL_DEBUG:
00246       levelStr = "DEBUG ";
00247       didLog = true;
00248       break;
00249     case LEVEL_TRACE:
00250       levelStr = "TRACE ";
00251       didLog = false;
00252       break;
00253     }
00254     if (didLog && msg && *msg)
00255     {
00256       std::cerr << levelStr << mLoggerName
00257       << " - " << msg;
00258       int len = strlen(msg);
00259       if (msg[len-1] != '\n')
00260         std::cerr << "\n";
00261     }
00262     return didLog;
00263   }

00272   Logger :: isGlobalLogging(Level level)

00278   Logger :: getName()

00282 
00283   bool
00284   Logger :: doJavaLog(Level level, const char* msg)
00285   {
00286     bool retval = false;
00287     JNIEnv *env=JNIHelper::sGetEnv();
00288     if (env)
00289     {
00290       if (!mJavaLogger && mClassMutex)
00291       {
00292         // acquire our mutex log
00293         mClassMutex->lock();
00294         // check it again in case someone made
00295         // a java logger while we waited for the lock.
00296         if (!mJavaLogger)
00297         {
00298           // this logger was initialized BEFORE
00299           // the class was initialized.  Let's reset it.
00300           Logger *jlogger = Logger::getLogger(mLoggerName);
00301           if (jlogger)
00302           {
00303             mJavaLogger = jlogger->mJavaLogger;
00304             jlogger->mJavaLogger = 0;
00305             delete jlogger;
00306           }
00307         }
00308         // release the mutex
00309         mClassMutex->unlock();
00310       }
00311       if (mJavaLogger)
00312       {
00313         jstring javaMsg = env->NewStringUTF(msg);
00314         retval = env->CallBooleanMethod(mJavaLogger,
00315             mLogMethod, (int)level, javaMsg);
00316         env->DeleteLocalRef(javaMsg);
00317         javaMsg = 0;
00318       }
00319     }
00320     return retval;
00321   }
00322 
00323   bool
00324   Logger :: log(const char* filename, int line, Level level, const char *fmt, ...)
00325   {
00326     bool didLog = false;
00327     va_list ap;
00328 
00329     va_start(ap, fmt);
00330     didLog = this->logVA(filename, line, level, fmt, ap);
00331     va_end(ap);
00332     return didLog;
00333   }
00334 
00335   bool
00336   Logger :: logVA(const char* filename, int line, Level level, const char *fmt, va_list ap)
00337   {
00338     bool didLog = false;
00339     if (mGlobalIsLogging[level] && mIsLogging[level])
00340     {
00341       char msg[cMaxLogMessageLength+1];
00342       formatMsg(msg, sizeof(msg), filename, line, fmt, ap);
00343       didLog = this->doLog(level, msg);
00344     }
00345     return didLog;
00346   }
00347 
00348 #define VS_LOGGER_CONVENIENCE_METHOD(__FUNCNAME, __LEVEL) \
00349   bool \
00350   Logger :: __FUNCNAME(const char* filename, int line, const char * fmt, ...) \
00351   { \
00352   Level level = __LEVEL; \
00353   bool didLog = false; \
00354   va_list ap; \
00355   va_start(ap, fmt); \
00356   if (mGlobalIsLogging[level] && mIsLogging[level]) \
00357   { \
00358     char msg[cMaxLogMessageLength+1]; \
00359     formatMsg(msg, sizeof(msg), filename, line, fmt, ap); \
00360     didLog = this->doLog(level, msg); \
00361   } \
00362   va_end(ap); \
00363   return didLog; \
00364   }
00365   VS_LOGGER_CONVENIENCE_METHOD(error, LEVEL_ERROR)
00366   VS_LOGGER_CONVENIENCE_METHOD(warn, LEVEL_WARN)
00367   VS_LOGGER_CONVENIENCE_METHOD(info, LEVEL_INFO)
00368   VS_LOGGER_CONVENIENCE_METHOD(debug, LEVEL_DEBUG)
